channel.title: MacOS on Chris Titus Tech | Tech Content Creator
channel.description: Recent content in MacOS on Chris Titus Tech | Tech Content Creator

item.title: Macos Sysadmin Tips
item.description: This comes from a reader that was a Sysadmin and transitioned from Linux to MacOS because of a visual impairment.

item.title: 2020 Buyers Guide
item.description: Looking for a Tech Gift this holiday season? Here are the things I have my eye on and are worth considering.

item.title: Linux MacOS
item.description: This Project is to make Ubuntu and other derivative distributions (Mint, PopOS, etc.) look like MacOS. Version 20+ is required

item.title: Common Computer Issues
item.description: These are all the issues we discussed on a live stream. I took all the community questions and made this webpage for them.

item.title: Change your Desktop Wallpaper
item.description: This article shows you how to automatically change your wallpaper on Windows, macOS, and Linux.

item.title: Opencore Mac
item.description: This goes over how to install macOS on pretty much any piece of hardware.

item.title: Zsh
item.description: In this article, I go over my implementation of ZSH, which is a better shell alternative to BASH.

item.title: Hackintosh Ryzen Install
item.description: Here is the basic install instruction for the Hackintosh Ryzen install that I used on my Ryzen 2700 with an RX 580.

item.title: Google Chrome missing www and how to fix it
item.description: Chrome started rolling out update 69 at the beginning of this month (September 2018) causing a missing www in the address bar. There are two things this update did that you need to be aware of.

item.title: Fix for Kernel Panic in Mac OSX
item.description: Follow these steps to fix a kernel panic in Mac OSX. However, if this doesn’t fix the issue, there is a good chance the motherboard is damaged and you need to send it to Apple.

item.title: Release and Renew IP in OS X
item.description: I recently had some issues where a bridged virtual machine in osx would disconnect my osx side network connection. A simple release and renew would fix this.
